meanings.definition: A competition in which participants spell words aloud.
meanings.sent1: During the spelldowns, the students took turns spelling challenging words.
meanings.sent2: The annual spelldowns at the school always drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent3: In the intense spelldowns, even the best spellers felt the pressure.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere in the spelldowns was electric, with tension hanging in the air.
meanings.sent5: The winner of the spelldowns proudly held up the trophy for all to see.

meanings.definition: The act of spelling words incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: Her frequent spelldowns in the spelling bee made her nervous.
meanings.sent2: He had a few spelldowns during the test, but overall he did well.
meanings.sent3: Despite his spelldowns, he managed to finish the assignment on time.
meanings.sent4: The spelldowns in his essay were a result of rushing through the writing process.
meanings.sent5: She tried to avoid spelldowns by double-checking her work before submitting it.
